basics.name: Valerie Landguth
basics.label: UX/UI Designer
basics.summary: I am hard-working, flexible, and a fast learner who is enthusiastic about making beautiful and easy to use products. I am a senior at Eastern Washington University and I am dedicated to applying what I have learned, to creating great experiences for users.

work.summary: Web Design and User Experience Design Teaching Assistant and Tutor. I answered questions in class and helped students find and solve problems in their HTML and CSS. I met with students outside of class who need extra help with assignments or projects, or gave feedback on students UI/UX design. I also helped write assessments and created a frequently asked questions page for students to refer to in future classes.

I designed a Weather.com experience for connected-car software, OpenCar (inrix.com/products/inrix-opencar/) from start to finish. This included creating an information architecture, wireframes, visuals, presenting to stakeholders, and iterating. I also created a style guide for the design team to use and conducted usability testing on OpenCar apps and presented my results with solutions.

references.name: John Hurr
references.reference: I had the opportunity to hire Valerie for a UX internship during the summer of 2017. She successfully shipped products to customers, conducted research projects, and built style guides for our team. She is a natural designer with a lot of deliberation and thoughtful decisions in her design work. Her flexibility and energy helped her tackle all types of challenges with different stakeholders during all stages of the design process. I would recommend Valerie for any UX position. Given the opportunity I would hire her again!
